skill.name: skill-creator
skill.description: Guidance for creating and packaging AI skills with clear structure, reusable resources, and validation steps.
skill.summary: Create consistent skills with templates, patterns, and packaging guidance.
skill.author: vercel-labs

security_audit.summary: Static findings mostly point to documentation examples and license text, which do not execute code or transmit data. Filesystem access is present only for packaging skills into a zip archive. No evidence of malicious intent or prompt injection was found in the scanned files.

low_findings.title: Filesystem packaging writes archives
low_findings.description: Verdict: TRUE_POSITIVE. The packager writes a .skill zip archive to disk as part of normal packaging. This is expected filesystem access, not malicious behavior. Confidence: 0.78. Confidence reasoning: The code opens a zip file for writing and iterates files for archiving.

low_findings.title: Documentation command examples misidentified as execution
low_findings.description: Verdict: FALSE_POSITIVE. The backticks appear in documentation and template strings, not in runtime command execution. They describe file names and example structures only. Confidence: 0.86. Confidence reasoning: The referenced lines are markdown or string literals with no subprocess calls.

low_findings.title: License URLs are informational text
low_findings.description: Verdict: FALSE_POSITIVE. The URLs appear in the Apache license text and are not used by any network code. No network calls are implemented in the skill. Confidence: 0.84. Confidence reasoning: The cited lines are in LICENSE.txt and contain only static text.

low_findings.title: Weak cryptography detections not supported by context
low_findings.description: Verdict: FALSE_POSITIVE. No cryptographic algorithms or hashing are implemented at these locations. No evidence found of weak cryptography usage in the cited lines. Confidence: 0.62. Confidence reasoning: The lines contain license or instructional text without crypto operations.

low_findings.title: System reconnaissance or sensitive key detections not supported
low_findings.description: Verdict: FALSE_POSITIVE. The validation script reads local SKILL.md content and exits; it does not probe the system or handle certificates. No evidence found of reconnaissance or key material handling in the cited lines. Confidence: 0.69. Confidence reasoning: The lines are input validation and exit logic without OS inspection or secret access.

content.value_statement: Creating reliable skills is time-consuming and inconsistent without guidance. This skill provides clear structure, reusable resource patterns, and packaging steps to speed delivery.
actual_capabilities: Explain the required skill structure and bundled resource folders
Guide creation of SKILL.md frontmatter and body sections
Provide workflow and output pattern references for consistent instructions
Describe how to initialize a skill with the init script
Describe how to validate and package a skill into a .skill file
limitations: Does not create a finished skill without user input and domain details
Does not run scripts or package artifacts on its own
Does not provide domain specific schemas or templates beyond examples
Does not review third party repositories for compliance

use_cases.title: Draft a new skill layout
use_cases.description: Plan the sections, resources, and examples needed for a new skill before writing files.

use_cases.title: Standardize team skill writing
use_cases.description: Align multiple contributors on SKILL.md structure, tone, and resource placement.

use_cases.title: Package skills for distribution
use_cases.description: Validate the skill folder and create a distributable .skill archive.

prompt_templates.title: Outline a simple skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a short outline for a skill that helps with log analysis. Include suggested SKILL.md sections and any scripts or references to add.

prompt_templates.title: Refine SKILL.md frontmatter
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this draft frontmatter and improve the description to include clear triggers and scope. Keep it under 1024 characters.

prompt_templates.title: Design resources for a complex workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Propose scripts, references, and assets needed for a multi step document processing skill. Explain when each resource should be used.
prompt_templates.scenario: Advanced skill author planning reusable assets

prompt_templates.title: Prepare packaging checklist
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide a packaging checklist for a completed skill, including validation steps and common mistakes to avoid.

output_examples.input: Outline a skill for PDF form filling
output: Section plan: Overview, Workflow Decision Tree, Step by step flow, Resource references

output_examples.input: How should I package the skill?
output_examples.output: Run the validation step, fix any frontmatter errors, then package the skill into a .skill archive.

best_practices: Keep SKILL.md concise and move detail into references
Use explicit workflows when tasks have ordered steps
Validate and package only after removing unused example files
anti_patterns: Adding extra documentation files that are not needed by the skill
Mixing detailed references into SKILL.md instead of separating them
Skipping validation before packaging a distributable skill

faq.question: What makes a skill trigger reliably?
faq.answer: Use a clear description in frontmatter that lists tasks, file types, and scenarios that should trigger the skill.

faq.question: When should I add scripts?
faq.answer: Add scripts when the same code is repeated or when deterministic automation is required.

faq.question: How should I structure long guidance?
faq.answer: Keep SKILL.md short and place detailed guidance in reference files linked from the main document.

faq.question: Do I need assets for every skill?
faq.answer: No. Use assets only when the output requires templates, images, fonts, or other files.

faq.question: How do I package a skill for sharing?
faq.answer: Validate the folder and then run the packaging script to create a .skill archive.

faq.question: What should I do after publishing?
faq.answer: Iterate based on real usage and update SKILL.md or resources when gaps appear.
